MemoryText:
I was in the living room playing with my Playmobil Zoo
I tried to grab and save all of my animals when the siren went on.

We celebrated my birthday at my aunt’s house.
She had better shelter.
I remember a big round table, a proper beautiful birthday cake and a lot of gas masks.

I followed my father around the house even when he went to the bathroom.
A siren went on.
I got really scared and I fell to the back of the bathtub and broke my hand.

I remember having to walk to my kindergarden with a pink box that had tones of
stickers. The box contained my  gas mask in, every kid had a spot for its
box on the wall.

First remebrance siren together with my parents.
standing in the house

Hearing the remebrance siren together with all my class mates.
Laughing, standing uncoumftables for one minute.

Me and my cousin were playing around the garden in my aunt’s house at the kibbutz, when all of a sudden a really loud siren went on. Both of us ran super fast back to the house where all the families were gathered and we screamed that a war is about to start. I remember that I ran like crazy, as fast that I could. That was the first time that I dealt with a siren outside of my house, without my parents. I was convinced that I was going to die that day. Later I realised it was an alarm for the pilots in a near by base for their lunch.

We lived on the 7th floor of our building.
Every time that there was an alarm we had to run 7 floors down.

Probably the most traumatic memory for me, both my parents were working,
I was already 18 years old, most of the time I was alone in the house, sometimes
with my brother. I didn’t hear the alarm going on because I was had my headphones on and then all of a sudden there was a huge blast. Only a minute later when my mom called I realised that there was a missile attack at a house near by.
Many times it took us a couple of minutes to hear back from my father, because so many people were also trying to call their loved ones to see if they are ok.
so many sirens went on that day, i just decided to stay in bed
we were in the forest, in the middle of my scouts summer camp.
i asked my mom to go to my aunt in the south of israel for the weekend, i didn't want to listen to the sirens.
6 sirens in a row.
i stayed at my grandma house just not to be alone during the day.
i gave up going back and forth from the 7th floor to the shelter, i just stayed on the stairs
some of my friends drafted to the army in the middle of the war
7 sirens in a row
7 sirens in a row

7 sirens in a row

7 sirens in a row
7 sirens in a row

4 sirens in a row
we spend 30 minutes on the stairs in my building, playing some cards game on the floor
3 sirens in a row

MemoryText: I vividly remember the first time I heard the remembrance while I was wearing the army uniform.

MemoryText:
Personally, I find it so hard to listen to this sound, a harsh deep sound that
 feels like its walking inside your body.

MemoryText: I was on my way home on the bus from university with my headphones on when all of the sudden everyone got off the bus at once. I was tired after a long day at school so I stayed on the bus, I thought that there was a problem. It was only when I looked to the other side that I saw a lot of people laying on the ground and that it was only me and 3 others still on the bus. I then realised that there was a siren going on. I waited to hear the blast, praying that nothing would hit us and I could continue my day.

Address: Bezalel Academy of art and design
Bezalel Academy of art and design
MemoryText: While preparing for the final thesis exhibition in my undergrad university we had to leave the space 10 times that day to go to the shelter. In a way it was a much better experience being with a big group of people. We have shared a lot of jokes this day.

Address: Bezalel Academy of art and design

MemoryText:
I woke up from the sound and got so scared that I went outside with my
pyjamas. I got some weird looks from my neighbours, which is when I realised that it was just
the national drill.

I never woke up for this alarm.
I learned about it the next day

We were in our house, when all of sudden we heard a distanced siren going on and off.
The first thing that I did was go outside and sit on the stairs according to the code of conduct. My boyfriend was laughing at me and didn't want to come with me, after 30 seconds the siren went off and the government released a statement that it was false.
